prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2412, 0.0] For the sketch, create a new face and add two loops. Loop 1: - Draw a circle at the center with a radius of 0.1837 and a second circle with a radius of 0.0459 concentric to the first one. Loop 2: - Draw a circle at the center with a radius of 0.0765 and a second circle with a radius of 0.0459 concentric to the first one. Then, extrude the sketch using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1224 - Sketch scale: 0.75 **Part 2: Longer Cylindrical Object with a Central Hole** Create a new coordinate system with the same parameters as Part 1: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2412, 0.0] For the sketch, create a new face and add a loop. Loop 1: - Draw a circle at the center with a radius of 0.1837, then draw six lines and two arcs to create a rectangle with a central hole. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.2412 - Sketch scale: 0.3673 **Part 3: Rod Connecting the Central Holes of Part 1 and Part 2** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.5969, 0.2412, 0.1071] For the sketch, create a new face and add a loop. Loop 1: - Draw a circle at the center with a radius of 0.0765, then draw a second circle with a radius of 0.0459 concentric to the first one. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.1837 - Sketch scale: 0.1531 Combine Part 1 and Part 2 using a "JoinFeatureOperation" before joining Part 3 on one end using the same operation. This will create the final shape: a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, connected by a curved rod.</description>
